intro: Dorstenia flagellifera, commonly known as the whipstick or whipplant, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its long, thin, whip-like stems that can grow up to several meters in length. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture with a distinctive waxy coating. The flowers are small, inconspicuous, and typically yellow or greenish, arranged in clusters along the stems.
